xml.transcript: Fifty Dollars Reward. RUNAWAY from the subscriber in Tenneffe, Smith County, some time ago a negro man of a yellow complexion, named Bill, near 6 feet high, light and trim built, about 25 years old, has a naked spot on the back of his head, and some scars on his breast, his cloathing is too numerous to describe, as he has worked for clothes since he runaway: said negro crossed the Ohio at Kenedy's ferry in March last; he has a forged pass with a number of names signed to it; also a certificate of his having worked with one Woods in the Illinois grant and of his good conduct while there: he had with him a brindled dog with crop'd ears and short tail, and a white bitch; he has altered his name and calls himself Tom Gibbs. Any person taking up negro and will return him to the subscriber or secures him in any jail in the United States, so he gets him shall receive the above reward and all reasonable expences. Sept, 4th, 1805. George Paine.
